Articles.Content:
Kerbals are not well understood

Edited June 6, 2013 by dr_jt

Stations can be in any design you like, from ISS reproductions to whacked out crazy mutant oh-my-god-how-did-that-get-in-space contraptions

It's up to you really, and what you want from your station.

Personally, I find stations indispensable, mostly because I have the Kethane pack. When .20 rolls out, I think they will become absolutely necessary. Currently they are useful as refueling stations no matter how you play.

I'm with sal_vager; it really depends on what you want to do with it. Me, I don't see a need for space stations at the moment, but that's because I design modular ships that assemble in orbit that make it up there almost fully fueled (they're sans the RCS fuel it takes to successfully rendezvous and dock and the booster of course). I'd probably use them if I had a definite purpose for them.

Like capi3101, I've only lofted two stations just to see if I could do it. The first was a simple Salyut style, then a pretty intricate Skylab replica. Skylab is the only one still in orbit, mainly for show. I have no intent of putting up anything "permanent" until the 1.0 release.
